channel.title: Comments on: Welcome to HA and DR week!
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Hugo Shebbeare
item.dc:creator: Hugo Shebbeare
item.content:encoded:
I dedicated a great time to this subject and have provided an open-source DRP here (visits just reached sixteen thousand, and very few critical comments): http://www.simple-talk.com/sql/backup-and-recovery/disaster-recovery-for-sql-server-databases-/

Look forward to yours.

Hugo
SQL Server MVP
Montreal, Canada

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: The funny thing is I had it that way and edited it back to follow the documentation most will read. But absolutely correct!
item.content:encoded: The funny thing is I had it that way and edited it back to follow the documentation most will read. But absolutely correct!

item.title: By: Robert L Davis
item.dc:creator: Robert L Davis
item.description: High Availability and High Protection operating modes for database mirroring are archaic terms that were used in the pre-release documentation for mirroring. The current terms are High Safety with Automatic Failover or High Safety without Automatic Failover.
item.content:encoded: High Availability and High Protection operating modes for database mirroring are archaic terms that were used in the pre-release documentation for mirroring. The current terms are High Safety with Automatic Failover or High Safety without Automatic Failover.
